result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jason Carl Harris

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jason Carl Harris in court.  Attorney Andrew Joel Golden in court for Jason Carl Harris.  Prosecuting attorney Elaine B. Fehrs in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Status Conference held.  Defense counsel is recently appointed and requests status conference date to tag along with defendant's other case.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Status conference scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Jason Carl Harris appeared by video. 
Case is set for a Status Conference. Following case #22CF3242. Matter is adjourned.
Status conference scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

HELD OFF THE RECORD
Defendant Jason Carl Harris appeared by video, in court. 
Case set for Status. Case tagging along with 22CF3242
Status conference scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Court ordered no contact with QQB
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring; no contact order.  If an Electronic Monitoring Device (GPS) is unavailable and Cash Bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the Electronic Monitoring (GPS) waiting list.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Jason Carl Harris in court with attorney Alexander J. Kostal.  Defendant Jason Carl Harris in custody.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jason Carl Harris appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Skwierawski, Branch 41.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned to Br. PE for Branch 41; with companion case 22CF3242.  Status conference scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
